tool.name: GeoCentre

param.name: in_dataset
param.displayname: Input Footprint (Feature Class or Raster Dataset/Catalog which defines footprint of interest)
param.dialogReference: Select an existing feature class which defines the geographical footprint required. The feature class must be based on a geographical coordinate system.

param.name: in_gdb
param.displayname: File Geodatabase for datasets created by tool
param.dialogReference: Select an existing File Geodatabase which will be used to store various datasets generated by the tool. If necessary create the File Geodatabase prior to running the tool.

param.name: out_fc
param.displayname: Name of geographic centre point feature class created by tool
param.dialogReference: Provide a name for the lattice point feature class to be stored in the File Geodatabase selected.

tool.summary:
Creates a point feature class for the geographic centre of an input dataset which defines a footprint of interest. Method is based on the iterative approach using the Azimuthal Equidistant projectionby Rogerson, P.A. (2015) ‘A New Method for Finding Geographic Centers, with Application to U.S. States’ in The Professional Geographer, 67(4), pp.686-694.

Provides an alternative to using the ArcGIS centroid geometry property which has unknown provenance, and uses this as as the initial approximation before carrying out a single iteration of the Rogerson method. This should be sufficient for most small to medium scale mapping applications when determining a centre point, for example to create a bespoke projected coordinate system based on an azimuthal projection.

searchKeys.keyword: geographic centre center azimuthal equidistant projection
